column4: hi, my ubuntu install just died and harddrives inaccessable (raid0 from mobo) any way to access the FS to atleast access the previous data to backup?
hi, my ubuntu install just died and harddrives inaccessable (raid0 from mobo) any way to access the FS to atleast access the previous data to backup?
Try the liveCD
im in the live cd right now.
Is there nothing in "places"?
i see my windows raid and my should be linux raid listed
good
when i click the linux raid i get the error> error mounting, mount exited with exit code 32, wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on... ect (cant copy and pstebin the dialog)
there http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/BX4BpVE2
I think I have experienced the exact same problem
I'll be back
Check this out: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1245536&highlight=invalid+journal+clear%3F
ok, if i manage just to access the few GB from my home folder i can do a clean reinstall, but this is a nforce CH10r raid0 and the p/table seems lost what i can @decode@
Have you checked the status of the array in "Disc Utility"? When that happened to me, the drives had changed their labels, sdj, sdk, sdl etc
it says unallocated space there.
i just tested "sudo fsck.ext4 /dev/mapper/isq..UbuntuRaid1" and it said :Superblock has an invalid journal (inode 8) Clear?" i answered no and it exited, dunno if that could help fix the hdd
thanks, checking
i can access the drive now, but onlt shows a lost+found folder and thats it..
I'm not sure, but it could be owner/user priviliegies
It could also be that the data is gone :)
Try to reboot?
iirc you were on the livecd?
in live cd yes
rebooting to see if it boots
